(?<image_type>front|packaging|ingredient.description:
See property `front` to get the real type of those objects
(Put this way because of a [bug in rapidoc](https://github.com/rapi-doc/RapiDoc/issues/880))

image(_(?<image_type>front|packaging|ing.description:
the URL of image of type `image_type` in size `image_size` (or full size if not given).

The `image_type` tells which image the url correspond to. `image_type` is `front` if not provided.

The image is the one for current language (affected by `lc` parameter) if an image exists for this language, the image in main product language otherwise.

**IMPORTANT:** you should use `selected_images` field instead of this one.

allOf.description:
Fields related to Eco-Score for a product.

See also: `ecoscore_score`, `ecoscore_grade` and `ecoscore_tags`.

ecoscore_data.title: product_ecoscore_data
ecoscore_data.description:
An object about a lot of details about data needed for Eco-Score computation
and complementary data of interest.

aggregated_origins.description: List of aggregated origins of ingredients and their impact.

origin.description: Country or region of origin for the ingredient.

percent.description: Percentage of this ingredient from the specified origin.

transportation_score.description: Transportation score associated with this ingredient's origin.

epi_score.description: Environmental Performance Index (EPI) score for the ingredient's origin.

origins_from_categories.description: List of origins derived from product categories, eg for PDO.

origins_from_origins_field.description: List of origins explicitly stated in the product's origins field.

quantity_per_unit.description: The quantity per packaging unit, as a string.

name_en.description:
This can be returned in many other languages
like name_fr (for french).

This can be returned in many other languages
like name_fr (for french).

allOf.title: product_nutrition
allOf.description:
Nutrition fields of a product

Most of these properties are read-only.

See [how to add nutrition data](https://openfoodfacts.github.io/openfoodfacts-server/api/ref-cheatsheet/#add-nutrition-facts-values-units-and-base)

no_nutrition_data.description:
When a product does not have nutrition data displayed on the
packaging, the user can check the field "Nutrition facts are
not specified on the product".
By doing so, the no_nutrition_data field takes the value "on".
This case is frequent (thousands of products).

nutrition_data_per.description:
The nutrition data on the package can be per serving or per 100g.

This is essential to understand if `<nutrient>_value` and `<nutrient>`
values in `nutriments` applies for a serving or for 100g.

**IMPORTANT:**
When writing products,
this setting applies to all existing nutrients values for the product,
not only the nutrient values sent in the write request.
So it should not be changed unless all nutrients values are provided
with values that match the nutrition_data_per field.

nutrition_data_prepared_per.description:
The nutrition data for prepared product on the package (if any) can be per serving or per 100g.

This is essential to understand if `<nutrient>_prepared_value` and `<nutrient>_prepared`
values in `nutriments` applies for a serving or for 100g.

See also important note on `nutrition_data_per`.

nutriments.description:
All known nutrients for the product.

Note that each nutrients are declined with a variety of suffixes like `_100g`, `_serving`,
see patternProperties below.

A specific `_unit` is the unit of the value that was entered by the contributor (a user or the manufacturer).
It is not necessarily the unit that is printed on the product, as some apps may force specific units when writing nutrient values.

Beware that some properties are to be interpreted based upon `nutrition_data_per` value.

For most use cases, you should use the `<nutrient>_100g` or `<nutrient>_serving` fields, as they are always in the same standard unit, for a specific quantity (100g or 1 serving).

For products that have a nutrition table for prepared product
(eg. the nutrition facts for a bowl of milk with cocoa powder),
a `_prepared` suffix is added (before other suffixes).

You can get all possible nutrients from the
[nutrients taxonomy](https://static.openfoodfacts.org/data/taxonomies/nutrients.json)

**FIXME** add more nutrients with description.

alcohol.description:
Quantity of alcohol

(per 100g or per serving) in a standard unit (g or ml)

carbohydrates.description: This is the available carbohydrates (excluding fiber), also known as net carbohydrates

carbohydrates-total.description: This follows the US / Canada definition of carbohydrates which includes fiber, also known as gross carbohydrates

energy.description:
It is the same as `energy-kj` if we have it, or computed from `energy-kcal` otherwise

(per 100g or per serving) in kj

energy_value.description: energy_value will be equal to energy-kj_value if we have it or to energy-kcal_value otherwise

energy_unit.description: Equal to energy-kj_unit if we have it or to energy-kcal_unit otherwise

energy-kcal.description:
energy in kcal, if it is specified

(per 100g or per serving) in a standard unit (g or ml)

energy-kj.description:
energy in kj, if it is specified

(per 100g or per serving) in a standard unit (g or ml)

fruits-vegetables-legumes-estimate-from-.description:
An estimate, from the ingredients list of the percentage of fruits, vegetable and legumes.
This is an important information for Nutri-Score (2023 version) computation.

fruits-vegetables-nuts-estimate-from-ing.description:
An estimate, from the ingredients list of the percentage of fruits, vegetable and nuts.
This is an important information for Nutri-Score (2021 version) computation.

nutrition-score-fr.description:
Experimental nutrition score derived from
the UK FSA score and adapted for the French market
(formula defined by the team of Professor Hercberg).

erythritol.description:
erythritol is a polyol which is not providing any energy.
As such, it needs not be taken into account when computing
the energy of a product. Eryhtritol is now displayed on
nutrition facts sheet of some products, mainly in the USA.
This value is entered either by contributors, either by
imports.

(?<nutrient>[\\w-]+)_unit.description:
The unit of the value entered by the contributor (a user or the manufacturer), for the product as sold (not prepared).
In most cases, this unit is the unit displayed on the product for the nutrient, but it is not guaranteed, as some apps may force specific units when writing nutrient values.          

The possible values depends on the nutrient.

* `g` for grams
* `mg` for milligrams
* `μg` for micrograms
* `cl` for centiliters
* `ml` for mililiters
* `dv` for recommended daily intakes (aka [Dietary Reference Intake](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dietary_Reference_Intake))
* `% vol` for alcohol vol per 100 ml

🤓 code: see the [Units module][units-module],
and [Food:default_unit_for_nid function][default-unit]

[units-module]: https://openfoodfacts.github.io/openfoodfacts-server/dev/ref-perl-pod/ProductOpener/Units.html
[default-unit]: https://openfoodfacts.github.io/openfoodfacts-server/dev/ref-perl-pod/ProductOpener/Food.html#default_unit_for_nid_(_%24nid)

**Note**: For most use cases, you should not use this unit, as it can change depending on how the value was entered.
Instead use the `<nutrient>_100g` or `<nutrient>_serving` fields, and convert them to the unit you need.

(?<nutrient>[\\w-]+)_100g.description:
The normalized value of the nutrient for 100g (or 100ml for liquids), in a standard unit, for the product as sold (not prepared):
* g for all nutrients that are measured by weight (e.g. fat, proteins, carbohydrates, sodium, vitamins, minerals etc.)
* % vol for nutrients that are percentages by volume (e.g. alcohol)
* kJ for energy and energy-kj
* kcal for energy-kcal
* no unit for pH

This is computed from the `nutrient` property,
the serving size (if `nutrient` is per serving), and the `nutrient`_unit field.

**Note**:
For most use cases, this is the only value you should use, as it is always in the same unit, and always per 100g or 100ml.

(?<nutrient>[\\w-]+)_serving.description:
The normalized value of the nutrient for one serving, in a standard unit:
- g for most nutrients
- % for nutrients that are percentages (e.g. alcohol)
- kJ for energy and energy-kj
- kcal for energy-kcal

This is computed from the `nutrient` property,
the serving size (if `nutrient` is per 100g), and the `nutrient`_unit field.

(?<nutrient>[\\w-]+)_value.description:
The value entered by the contributor (a user or the manufacturer).
In most cases, the unit of the value is the unit displayed on the product for the nutrient, but it is not guaranteed, as some apps may force specific units when writing nutrient values.          

* per 100g or serving, depending on `nutrition_data_per` field.
* in the unit of the corresponding <nutrient>_unit field.

**Note**: For most use cases, you should not use this value, as it can be in different units, and can be per 100g or per serving.

(?<nutrient>[\\w-]+)_prepared.description: Same as '(?<nutrient>[\w-]+)', for the prepared product (not as sold).

(?<nutrient>[\\w-]+)_prepared_unit.description: Same as '(?<nutrient>[\w-]+)_unit', for the prepared product (not as sold).

(?<nutrient>[\\w-]+)_prepared_100g.description: Same as '(?<nutrient>[\w-]+)_100g', for the prepared product (not as sold).

(?<nutrient>[\\w-]+)_prepared_serving.description: Same as '(?<nutrient>[\w-]+)_serving', for the prepared product (not as sold).

(?<nutrient>[\\w-]+)_prepared_value.description: Same as '(?<nutrient>[\w-]+)_value', for the prepared product (not as sold).

nutriscore_data.description:
Detail of data the Nutri-Score was computed upon.

**Note**: this might not be stable, don't rely too much on this, or, at least, tell us !

Some products with multiple components might have multiple Nutri-Score

Nutri-Score for the product as a letter.

Nutri-Score for the product as a letter.

See https://world.openfoodfacts.org/nutriscore.

See https://world.openfoodfacts.org/nutriscore.

Nutri-Score for the product as a letter.

See https://world.openfoodfacts.org/nutriscore.

nutriscore_grade.description:
Nutri-Score for the product as a letter.

See https://world.openfoodfacts.org/nutriscore.

nutriscore_score.description: Nutri-Score for the product as an integer (see also `nutriscore_grade`).

allOf.description: This is data that is linked to products data quality

items.description:
Each data quality bug describes a data quality bug on the product.

Refer to the [data quality taxonomy](https://static.openfoodfacts.org/data/taxonomies/data_quality.json)

Each Data Quality Error describes a data quality error on the product.

Refer to the [data quality taxonomy](https://static.openfoodfacts.org/data/taxonomies/data_quality.json)

Each Data Quality Info describes a data quality info on the product.

Refer to the [data quality taxonomy](https://static.openfoodfacts.org/data/taxonomies/data_quality.json)

Each Data Quality tag describes a data quality issue on the product.

Refer to the [data quality taxonomy](https://static.openfoodfacts.org/data/taxonomies/data_quality.json)

Each Data Quality warning tag describes a data quality warning on the product.

Refer to the [data quality taxonomy](https://static.openfoodfacts.org/data/taxonomies/data_quality.json)

data_sources.description: Source of data imported from producers.

states.description:
comma separated list of values indicating some states of the product,
like things to be done, or to be completed.
See [states taxonomy](https://static.openfoodfacts.net/data/taxonomies/states.json)

items.description:
Each state describe something that is completed or is to be done or improved on the product.

Refer to [states taxonomy](https://static.openfoodfacts.net/data/taxonomies/states.json)

misc_tags.description:
Information about different aspect of the product
  Refer to [misc taxonomy](https://static.openfoodfacts.org/data/taxonomies/misc.json)

additionalProperties.description: those are properties taken from the category taxonomy

compared_to_category.description:
the category to use for comparison.

**TODO** explain how it is chosen.

link.description: link to the product on the website of the producer

owner_fields.description:
Those are fields provided by the producer (through producers platform),
and the value he provided.

additionalProperties.description:
you can retrieve all kind of properties, the same as on the parent object (the product).
It's not processed entries (like tags for example) but raw ones.

nova_groups_markers.description: Detail of ingredients or processing that makes the products having Nova 3 or 4

items.description: This array has two elements for each marker. The first element is the tag type of the marker (e.g. "ingredients", "additives", "categories"), and the second is the tag id in the taxonomy (e.g. "en:e471")

purchase_places.description: Country, state, or city where the product can be purchased.

allOf.description: Metadata of a product (author, editors, creation date, etc.)

created_t.description:
Date when the product was added (UNIX timestamp format).
See also `entry_dates_tags`

creator.description: The contributor who added the product first.

editors_tags.description: List of editors who edited the product.

languages_codes.description: Same as `languages` but by language code, instead of language tags

last_modified_by.description: The username of the user who last modified the product.

last_modified_t.description:
Date when the product page was last modified.
This date is updated only when primary data is modified (data entered by the user or updated by an interface)

last_updated_t.description:
Date when the product page was last modified.
This date is updated when primary data or secondary data is modified
(primary: data entered by a user or read from an interface, secondary: data computed by a utility
such as update_all_products.pl)

owner.description: Id of the producer in case he provides his own data about a product (producer platform).

rev.description: revision number of this product version (each edit adds a revision)

allOf.description: Knowledge panels for a product

knowledge_panels.title: panels
knowledge_panels.description:
The panels object is a dictionary of individual panel objects.
Each key of the dictionary is the id of the panel, and the value is the panel object.

Apps typically display a number of root panels with known panel ids (e.g. health_card and environment_card). Panels can reference other panels and display them as sub-panels.

additionalProperties.title: panel
additionalProperties.description: Each panel contains an optional title and an optional array of elements.

type.description: Type of the panel. If set to "card", the panel and its sub-panels should be displayed in a card. If set to "inline", the panel should have its content always displayed.

expanded.description: If true, the panel is to be displayed already expanded. If false, only the title should be displayed, and the user should be able to click or tap it to open the panel and display the elements.

expand_for.description: If set to "large", the content of the panel should be expanded on large screens, but it should still be possible to unexpand it.

evaluation.description: An evaluation status specifically for this title element. This can be used to directly color the icon if 'icon_color_from_evaluation' is true and this field is present, or it might provide context for the title itself. e.g. bad is red. Please be careful in choosing colors, to avoid 50 shades of red.

half_width_on_mobile.description: If true, suggests that this panel could be rendered as half-width on mobile devices, allowing for side-by-side display with another half-width panel if applicable.

name.description: A short name of this panel, not including any actual values. e.g. "Fat"

type.description: Used to indicate how the value of this item is measured, such as "grade" for Nutri-Score and Green-Score or "percentage" for Salt

grade.description: The value for this panel where it corresponds to a A to E grade such as the Nutri-Score or the Green-Score.

value.description: The numeric value of the panel, where the type is "percentage"

value_string.description: The string value of the panel, for cases where the value is not numeric

icon_size.description: If set to "small", the icon should be displayed at a small size.

elements.description: An ordered list of elements to display in the content of the panel.

items.title: element
items.description: Each element object contains one specific element object such as a text element or an image element.

element_type.description:
The type of the included element object.
The element_type also indicates which field contains the included element object.
e.g. if the element_type is "text", the included element object will be in the "text_element" field.

Note that in the future, new type of element may be added,
so your code should ignore unrecognized types, and unknown properties.

TODO: add Map type

text_element.title: text_element
text_element.description:
A text in simple HTML format to display.

For some specific texts that correspond to a product field (e.g. a product name, the ingredients list of a product),the edit_field_* fields are used to indicate how to edit the field value.

type.description: the type of text, might influence the way you display it.

html.description: Text to display in HTML format.

language.description: Language of the text. The name of the language is returned in the language requested when making the API call. e.g. if the text is in Polish, and the requested language is French, the language field will contain "Polonais" (French for "Polish"). Only set for specific fields such as the list of ingredients of a product.

lc.description: 2 letter language code for the text. Only set for specific fields such as the list of ingredients of a product.

edit_field_id.description: id of the field used to edit this text in the product edit API.

edit_field_value.description: Current value of the product field. This may differ from the html field which can contain extra formating.

width.description:
Width of the image.

This is just a suggestion coming from the server, 
the client may choose to use its own dimensions for the image.

height.description:
Height of the image.

This is just a suggestion coming from the server,
the client may choose to use its own dimensions for the image.

action_element.title: action_element

actions.description: The ids of the actions to show.

items.description: The id of the action to show.

action_element.description: The action element is used to display a title and a list of actions like editing a product or adding categories.

panel_element.title: panel_element
panel_element.description: Panels can include other panels as sub-panels using the panel_element.

panel_id.description: The id of the panel to include. The id is the key of the panel in the panels object returned in the knowledge_panels field.

panel_group_element.title: panel_group_element

panel_ids.description: The ids of the panels to include. The ids are the keys of the panels in the panels object returned in the knowledge_panels field.

image.description: An image related to the panel group (e.g. the ingredients or nutrition facts image for the ingredients and nutrition panel groups).

panel_group_element.description: The panel group element is used to display an optional title followed by a number of sub-panels.

table_type.description: Type of table (e.g. "percents" for tables with percentage columns)

icon_url.description: URL of an icon to display in the cell

percent.description: Percentage value for progress bars (used with percent columns)

evaluation.description: Evaluation level (good, bad, neutral, etc.) for styling

level.description:
a message level, as levels we use in log.
It might help theming the panel visually. Some possible values: info, recommendation

size.description:
size is either empty (normal display) 
or small to indicate a panel that should have a smaller font size

topics.description: topics currently include health, environment, problem

allOf.description: Specific data about a product to enable personal ranking

attribute_groups.description: Each element is an attribute that can help compute a personal ranking for the product

id.description:
Unique id of the attribute.

It will be use to match against preferences parameters.

status.description: wether we have the information to really compute this criteria or not.

title.description: A descriptive sentence about the situation of the product concerning attribute

match.description:
a numeric value for the match,
telling how much the products ranks well for this particular attribute.
The higher the value, the better the match.

grade.description: every attribute as a grade for a to e

name.description: The name of attribute, for eventual display

icon_url.description: an icon representing the attribute match (often using a color)

description.description: An eventual description of the value of the property upon which this attribute is based

description_short.description: An eventual short description of the value of the property upon which this attribute is based

ingredients.title: ingredients
ingredients.description:
This structure gives the different ingredients and some information about them,
like estimate on their quantity.

vegan.description: Indicates if the ingredient is vegan.

vegetarian.description: Indicates if the ingredient is vegetarian.

name.description: Name of the nutrient in the requested language

important.description: Indicates if the nutrient is always shown on the nutrition facts table

display_in_edit_form.description: Indicates if the nutrient should be shown in the nutrition facts edit form

unit.description: Default unit of the nutrient

nutrients.description:
Nutrients and sub-nutrients of a product, with their name and default unit.
(e.g. saturated-fat is a sub-nutrient of fat).
